GameState

Class InputScoreState

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameState.GameState
      • GameState.InputScoreState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class InputScoreState
extends GameState
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class is the input score screen state, and allows the user to see their end score and submit it to the scores file.
    Version:
    3.0 June 12 2014
    Author:
    Kareem Golaub modified by Peter Huang

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile()
        This method checks if the current score is larger than any of the scores in the scores.txt file, and rewrites accordingly.
        Parameters:
        scores - int[] holds the scores from the file
        names - String[] holds the names from the file
        difficulties - String[] holds the difficulties from the file
